{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3413416,"name":"Wilson","username":"Space13","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/d78d45/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-08-05T18:50:17.957Z","cooked":"

Ignoring the skill gap or schools not teaching c++ as much, does c++ have any advantage over java or python? What would a benefit of c++ be over the other languages, or any drawbacks? Is there any reason teams don’t use it as much besides lack of examples, students not being as familiar with it, etc?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-08-05T18:50:17.957Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":155,"reads":271,"readers_count":270,"score":844.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":469549,"topic_slug":"is-c-still-viable-in-frc","display_username":"Wilson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60393,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/is-c-still-viable-in-frc/469549/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3413427,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-05T18:55:11.724Z","cooked":"

C++ will always be viable; it’s essentially the primary language for the controller. Whether it’s worth it for your team depends critically on your team’s resources.

C++ is much less-forgiving, but offers much more consistent real-time performance if you use it correctly.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-08-05T18:56:03.793Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":268,"readers_count":267,"score":183.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":469549,"topic_slug":"is-c-still-viable-in-frc","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/is-c-still-viable-in-frc/469549/2","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":7},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":8,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3413432,"name":"Seth David Bragdon","username":"Seth-Gearcats6500","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/b9bd4f/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-08-05T19:05:46.160Z","cooked":"

Does C++ have libraries like those provided by WPILib and Rev Robotics for Java and C? One reason my team uses Java is because there are lots of FRC libraries and resources that are compatible with Java.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-08-05T19:05:46.160Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":253,"readers_count":252,"score":65.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":469549,"topic_slug":"is-c-still-viable-in-frc","display_username":"Seth David Bragdon","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":12381,"username":"Oblarg","name":"Eli Barnett","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67316,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Gearcats 6500 Programming Exec"},"post_url":"/t/is-c-still-viable-in-frc/469549/3","custom_user_title":"Gearcats 6500 Programming Exec","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3413434,"name":"Chris Bonomi","username":"BonomiC","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bonomic/{size}/228966_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-05T19:23:30.257Z","cooked":"

WPILib and Rev/CTRE all provide C++ libraries. But many open source libs that I’ve seen recently heavily favor Java

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-08-05T19:23:30.257Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":230,"readers_count":229,"score":66.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469549,"topic_slug":"is-c-still-viable-in-frc","display_username":"Chris Bonomi","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":67316,"username":"Seth-Gearcats6500","name":"Seth David Bragdon","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/b9bd4f/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66288,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"195 Software Mentor | Drive Coach"},"post_url":"/t/is-c-still-viable-in-frc/469549/4","custom_user_title":"195 Software Mentor | Drive Coach","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3413437,"name":"Drew Williams","username":"jreneew2","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jreneew2/{size}/135239_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-05T19:27:42.568Z","cooked":"

All of the vendors that I can think of provide C++ libraries. This is partly because a lot of the functions are written using JNI

Ctre
Rev
Navx
Pathplanner
Playing with fusion
Choreo
Photonvision
Limelight

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-08-05T19:27:42.568Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":231,"readers_count":230,"score":46.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":469549,"topic_slug":"is-c-still-viable-in-frc","display_username":"Drew Williams","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":67316,"username":"Seth-Gearcats6500","name":"Seth David Bragdon","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/b9bd4f/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":21777,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":" I moved to California just for districts"},"post_url":"/t/is-c-still-viable-in-frc/469549/5","custom_user_title":" I moved to California just for districts","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3413438,"name":"Kevin","username":"bobotics","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bobotics/{size}/223603_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-05T19:27:45.403Z","cooked":"

From my experience, c++ has less documentation and support for third party libraries, but it is still definitely viable

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-08-05T19:27:45.403Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":224,"readers_count":223,"score":59.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":469549,"topic_slug":"is-c-still-viable-in-frc","display_username":"Kevin","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65876,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5212 | Local Idiot Robot Doctor"},"post_url":"/t/is-c-still-viable-in-frc/469549/6","custom_user_title":"5212 | Local Idiot Robot Doctor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3413621,"name":"Allen Nuttle","username":"nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-06T05:30:07.713Z","cooked":"

Better performance, lower resource utilization, and higher determinism. So yeah, it’s not only viable, but the right choice for some. If you doubt, take a look at the thread on running code on a roboRIO 1.0, or do a search for issues related to garbage collection in Java.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-08-06T05:30:07.713Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":161,"readers_count":160,"score":77.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":469549,"topic_slug":"is-c-still-viable-in-frc","display_username":"Allen Nuttle","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14283,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/is-c-still-viable-in-frc/469549/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3413628,"name":"Levi","username":"nobody5690","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nobody5690/{size}/203585_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-06T06:29:48.529Z","cooked":"

Going to shameless plug our software whitepaper for this year as a good example of what’s possible in C++ if you have good mentor support. I will say though that with only ~90 teams using c++ command based this year, it’s probably best only for teams that are able to commit to the effort of solving problems on their own.
